CHAT.comment: Teaching. Mother and Child sit on the living+room floor. Mother first teaches Child to string beads on a shoelace. Then she teaches Child to sort black and white buttons into separate piles. Mother is hampered in this by the younger brother , Kirk , who keeps crawling into the picture. Child does not talk much. His utterances are mostly one word but are fairly clear.

u.a: gives Child other end of string .
gives bead and string to Mother .
give string and new bead to Child .
gives Child other end of string .
tries to string bead , not clear he's addressing Mother .
takes up other string and a bead .
continues to work on own string , unclear if he is addressing Mother .
puts handful of buttons in box .
grabs handfuls of buttons and holds them over boxes .
